title: QuickPay Faces Backlash Over Unauthorized Data Sharing
author: Michael Brown

content.intro: Payment app QuickPay has agreed to a $4.75 million settlement after selling user transaction data to third-party advertisers without consent.

sections.title: What Did QuickPay Do Wrong?
sections.content: An investigation revealed that QuickPay shared users' spending habits, locations, and contact details with marketing firms, violating privacy laws.

sections.title: Who Can Claim Compensation?
sections.content: All U.S. users who had an active account between **2020-2024** are eligible for a $50-$200 payment, depending on usage.

sections.title: Future Privacy Changes
sections.content: QuickPay must now obtain explicit user consent before sharing data and allow opt-out options for data tracking.
